subject: Career
title: Remote Work as Compensation
description: A quick win: understand Remote Work as Compensation.

hook.text: A Stanford study found workers value remote flexibility at about 8% of their salary.

buildup.text: No commute saves time, money, and stress. That has real economic value you can quantify.

discovery.text: If negotiating remote work, frame it as a benefit to both parties: lower office costs, wider talent pool.

twist.text: Some companies use remote work to justify lower pay: 'You're saving on commute so we pay less.'

climax.text: Know the trade-off. Remote flexibility is valuable â€” but don't let it silently replace fair pay.

punchline.text: Flexibility has value. Know exactly how much.

quiz.question: How much do workers value remote flexibility according to Stanford research?
